com.here.msdkui.common

Class DateFormatterUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.msdkui.common.DateFormatterUtil

  • public final class DateFormatterUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A convenience class to convert Date to a readable string representation or to convert a formatted string to a Calendar representation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String format(android.content.Context context, java.util.Date date)
      Converts Date to a short string representation using abbreviations.
      static java.lang.String format(java.util.Date date)
      Converts Date to a string representation using DateFormat.SHORT and the default locale of device.
      static java.util.Calendar format(java.lang.String dateString)
      Converts the given string of format dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss to Calendar.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public static java.util.Calendar format(java.lang.String dateString)
        Converts the given string of format dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss to Calendar.
        Parameters:
        dateString - source string to be converted to Calendar.
        Returns:
        a Calendar or null when source string could not be parsed.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Date date)
        Converts Date to a string representation using DateFormat.SHORT and the default locale of device.
        Parameters:
        date - the Date to be converted to string representation.
        Returns:
        a formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(android.content.Context context,
                                      java.util.Date date)
        Converts Date to a short string representation using abbreviations.

        In general, times are abbreviated by not showing the minutes if they are 0. For example, instead of "3:00pm" the time would be abbreviated to "3pm". If date is not today, month is shown as a 3-letter string.

        Parameters:
        context - the required context.
        date - the Date to be converted to string representation.
        Returns:
        a string containing the formatted date.
